Headlines: Ambani’s Reliance Industries Considers Record $1.8 Billion Bond Sale
Description: Indian tycoon Mukesh Ambani’s Reliance Industries Ltd. is considering raising as much as 150 billion rupees ($1.8 billion) via the sale of local-currency bonds, according to people familiar with the matter who asked not to be identified because the matter is private.

Headlines: Mukesh Ambani receives death threat for third time, sender demands Rs 400 crore as ransom
Description: Reliance Industries chairperson has been receiving death threats from a single e-mail address for the past 4 days

Headlines: Mukesh Ambani receives third threat email with ₹400 crore demand
Description: Mukesh Ambani, Chairman of Reliance Industries, Mumbai, has received a threat email demanding ₹400 crore. This is the third such email in four days. Police are investigating and have registered an FIR. Last year, a man from Bihar was arrested for making death threats to Ambani and his family.

Headlines: Jio World Plaza: Largest Luxury Mall Of India To Open On November 1 - News18
Description: India is about to gain a new luxury shopping destination as Reliance Industries to unveil country’s largest luxury shopping venue

Headlines: Reliance Industries Q2 Review: Analysts See Steady Earnings Outlook In FY24
Description:
Analysts see Reliance Industries Ltd.'s full-year outlook to be positive given the strong scaling of retail and telecom segments coupled with domestic demand pulling up the oil-to-chemicals segment.

“We retain our 'buy' on Reliance Industries on the back of a steady earnings outlook and the peaking-out of the current capex cycle, which should entail free cash flow generation and debt reduction,” said Sabri Hazarika, analyst with Emkay Global Financial Research, in a report.

Headlines: Reliance Industries Q2 Results Review - Inline; Recent Correction Led To An Upgrade: Systematix
Description:
Reliance Industries Ltd. reported healthy results during Q2 FY24 but largely in line with our estimates. Ebitda was up 31% YoY/8% QoQ to Rs 410 billion largely led by growth across segments while net profit increased 27% YoY/9% QoQ to Rs 174 billion. 

Upstream segment Ebitda improved 19% QoQ to Rs 163 billion (+50% YoY) followed by Retail at Rs 48 billion (13% QoQ) while oil-to-chemical and digital services were up 7% and 3% to Rs 163 billion and Rs 141 billion respectively. Ebitda from the upstream segment improved

Headlines: Reliance Industries, Ujjivan SFB, Aavas Financiers, Indian Hotels, Route Mobile, Q2 Review: HDFC Securities
Description:
Reliance Industries - Robust earnings from energy businessesUjjivan Small Finance Bank -  Customer franchise poised for an upgrade Indian Hotels - Continues to ride the strong demand wave Route Mobile - Deal wins improve growth visibilityHome First Finance Company
Strong performance; priced to perfectionAavas Financiers
Growth momentum key to regaining sector leadership

Headlines: Stocks To Watch: Reliance Industries, BPCL, Adani Green, Bombay Dyeing, M&M Financial Services
Description:
India's benchmark stock indices advanced over 1% on Friday after declining for six consecutive days following geopolitical uncertainties stemming from the Israel-Hamas war and the resultant rise in crude prices, coupled with higher-for-longer U.S. rates.

The S&P BSE Sensex closed 634.65 points up, or 1.01%, at 63,789.80, while the NSE Nifty 50 ended 190 points, or 1.01%, higher at 19,047.25.

Intraday, the S&P BSE Sensex rose 1.21% to 63,913.13, and the NSE Nifty 50 gained 1.16% to 19,076.15.

Headlines: Reliance Industries Q2 Results Review - Oil-To-Chemical, E&P, Retail Propel Earnings: Dolat Capital
Description:
Reliance Industries Ltd.’s Ebitda was up 31% YoY & 8% QoQ to Rs 410 billion (inline with estimates), led by strong operating performance across segment. Oil-to-chemical major driverminimal impact of export duties ($0.6/barreli of oil) to gross refining margin;
sequential improvement in GRM, PVC deltas, and ethane cracking economics favorable. RIL’s Ebitda was also boosted by exploration and production (sharp jump in KG gas production with higher price realisation).Profit after tax was up 27% YoY & 9% QoQ to Rs 174 billion (4% below estimates).

Headlines: Industrialist Mukesh Ambani gets death threat in email, Mumbai police launch manhunt
Description: Reliance Industries chairman Mukesh Ambani has received an email threatening to shoot him dead if he failed to pay ₹20 crore, a Mumbai police official said

Headlines: Reliance Industries Q2 Results: Profit Rises 8.6% In Line With Estimates
Description:
Reliance Industries Ltd.'s second-quarter profit rose on higher sales and overall performance.

The Mukesh Ambani-led conglomerate’s consolidated net profit attributable to owners rose 8.63% sequentially to Rs 17,394 crore in the quarter ended September, according to its exchange filing. That compares with the Rs 17,850.9 crore consensus estimate of analysts tracked by Bloomberg.

Headlines: Isha, Akash and Anant Ambani Get Shareholders’ Nod for Appointment as RIL Non-Executive Directors - News18
Description: The move is in line with gradually promoting Isha, Akash and Anant to head different businesses within the Reliance Industries

Headlines: Reliance Industries, Maruti Suzuki, Bajaj Finserv Q2 Results Today — Earnings Estimates
Description:
Reliance Industries Ltd. will announce its results for the quarter ended September on Friday. 

According to the average of analysts' estimates calculated by Bloomberg, Reliance Industries could report a net profit of Rs 17,850.9 crore and a revenue of Rs 2,23,433.6 crore in the quarter under review.

Headlines: Q2 Results 2023 this week: RIL, Axis Bank, TechM, Maruti Suzuki India, BPCL, and more
Description: Q2 results 2023 news: Apart from the Dussehra stock market holiday, widely tracked companies such as Reliance Industries and Maruti Suzuki will declare their earnings this week.

Headlines: Mcap of Top-10 Valued Firms Plunges Rs 1.52 Lakh Crore - News18
Description: In the ranking of top 10 firms, Reliance Industries retained the title of the most valued firm followed by TCS, HDFC Bank, ICICI Bank, Infosys, Hindustan Unilever, ITC, Bharti Airtel, State Bank of India and Bajaj Finance

Headlines: Ambani’s Youngest Son, Anant, Faces Proxy Firms’ Pushback On Board Seat
Description: Institutional Shareholder Services Inc., an international proxy advisory firm, has recommended that shareholders vote against the proposal to appoint billionaire Mukesh Ambani’s youngest son, Anant Ambani, on the board of the family-controlled Reliance Industries Ltd., underscoring concerns around succession planning at India’s largest company by market value.

Headlines: Mcap of Six of Top-10 Firms Jumps Rs 70,527.11 Crore; Reliance Industries Biggest Gainer - News18
Description: While Hindustan Unilever Ltd, Bharti Airtel, ITC, ICICI Bank and HDFC Bank were the gainers, Infosys, Tata Consultancy Services (TCS), State Bank of India and Bajaj Finance emerged as the laggards

Headlines: Mcap of six of top 10 firms jumps ₹70,527.11 crore; Reliance Industries biggest gainer
Description: The market capitalisation (mcap) of ICICI Bank rose ₹4,581.64 crore to ₹6,66,639.07 crore

Headlines: Reliance Industries chairman Mukesh Ambani visits Badrinath Dham
Description: In October last year, Ambani had visited Badrinath Dham and Kedarnath Dham

Headlines: Rs 3.3 lakh cr! Mukesh Ambani surpasses Gautam Adani in Hurun rich list
Description: Mukesh Ambani’s ranking soared despite Reliance Industries’ lackluster performance in the stock market, says the Hurun rich list.

Headlines: Mukesh Ambani overtakes Gautam Adani to secure ‘richest Indian’ title on Hurun India Rich List 2023
Description: Reliance Industries Limited has made cumulative investments exceeding $150 billion in the last decade, surpassing any other corporation in India, the report said.

Headlines: Reliance unveils swappable batteries for EVs
Description: Reliance Industries showcases swappable battery storage tech for EVs, part of $10B green push. Batteries can be swapped at stations or recharged using rooftop solar. Working on customizable batteries, intelligent swap stations, integrated charging networks. Won incentive to set up 5GWh battery manufacturing facility. Aim to cut pollution, promote wider adoption of EVs.

Headlines: Mcap of Five of Top 10 Most Valued Firms Decline by Rs 62,586 Crore; TCS, Infosys Biggest Laggards - News18
Description: In the ranking of the most-valued firms, Reliance Industries remains at the top followed by TCS, HDFC Bank, ICICI Bank, Infosys, Hindustan Unilever, ITC, State Bank of India, Bharti Airtel and Bajaj Finance

Headlines: Mukesh Ambani’s Children Will Get No Salary, Only Fee For Attending Board Meetings
Description:
Billionaire Mukesh Ambani's three children as directors of Reliance Industries Ltd will be paid only a fee for attending board and committee meetings, the company said in a resolution seeking shareholder nod for their appointment on its board.

The terms of the appointment of the three are the same as the ones on which Ambani's wife Nita was appointed to the company board in 2014.

Headlines: Reliance Industries: Key Support Level To Watch As The Stock Enters Oversold Zone
Description: Reliance Industries, India's largest conglomerate, may transform into a holding company, according to a report by CreditSights. The report said that this move could unlock value for shareholders.

Headlines: Reliance Industries Hits Oversold Level After Six-Month Gap
Description: Reliance Industries Ltd. fell for a fifth day, pushing India’s largest company by market valuation into oversold territory for the first time since March. Some investors may see that as a potential for a rebound, as has been the case when shares hit that technical level previously.

Headlines: Stocks To Watch: SBI, Reliance Industries, LIC, JSW Steel, Bajaj Finance, Delta Corp
Description:
U.S. stocks gained as bond yields retreated and oil fell at the end of a jittery week that saw investors positioning for a higher-for-longer Federal Reserve stance, reported Bloomberg.

The S&P 500 was up 0.03% and the tech-heavy Nasdaq 100 traded 0.27% higher as on 2:01 p.m. New York time. On the other hand, Dow Jones Industrial Average was down 0.06%.

Headlines: Sensex, Nifty fall in early trade on weak global trends ahead of U.S. Fed interest rate decision
Description: Mumbai equity benchmarks fell on Sept 20 due to weak global trends ahead of U.S. Fed's rate decision. HDFC Bank, Reliance Industries, Bharti Airtel, Maruti, Titan & HUL were major laggards. NTPC, IndusInd Bank, Axis Bank & Mahindra & Mahindra were gainers.

Headlines: Gas Price For Reliance Industries To Be Reduced By 14% From Next Month
Description: The price of natural gas produced from difficult areas like KG-D6 of Reliance Industries Ltd. is likely to be cut by about 14% from next month in line with softening energy prices, sources said.For the six-month period starting October 1, the price of gas from deep sea and high-pressure, high-temperature areas is likely to be cut to around $10.4 per million British thermal unit from the current $12.12, they said.

Headlines: Disney India Sale Talks Draw Firms Including Reliance
Description: Walt Disney Co. has held preliminary talks with potential buyers for its India streaming and television business including billionaire Mukesh Ambani’s Reliance Industries Ltd., according to people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Sensex, Nifty fall after record-breaking rally; investors await Fed rate decision
Description: On Sept. 18, Sensex & Nifty ended lower after 11-day rally due to weak global markets & caution ahead of Fed's rate decision. HDFC Bank, Bharti Airtel, Infosys, UltraTech Cement, Tata Steel, Wipro, Kotak Mahindra Bank, Reliance Industries, Tech Mahindra & JSW Steel were major laggards. Asian markets ended mixed, while European & US markets ended in negative territory. FIIs bought equities worth Rs 164.42 crore. Brent crude rose 0.39% to $94.30/barrel.

Headlines: Delhi High Court To Hear Government Plea Against RIL in KG-D6 Gas Block Case
Description:
The Delhi High Court has agreed to hear the government's plea in a dispute relating to the KG-D6 gas block arbitration case, involving Reliance Industries Ltd.

The division bench of Justices Manmohan and Mini Pushkarna agreed to hear the centre’s plea against RIL, for allegedly syphoning gas in the Bay of Bengal. The matter is now likely to be listed on Feb. 12.

Headlines: Reliance Industries, Tata Communications Shares Rise On Nvidia Tie-Ups
Description:
Shares of Tata Communications Ltd. and Reliance Industries Ltd. rose on Monday after they entered into partnerships with Nvidia Corp. to build large-scale artificial intelligence infrastructure.

The U.S.-based chipmaker has tied up with the conglomerates to build infrastructure-as-a-service and platform for AI services.

Headlines: Reliance Industries Donates Rs 25 Crore to Uttarakhand for Flood Relief - News18
Description: Anant Ambani made the donation on behalf of the company to the Mukhya Mantri Rahat Kosh, or the Chief Minister’s Relief Fund

Headlines: Nvidia to Partner With India’s Tata and Reliance for AI Development
Description: Nvidia Corp. plans to partner with the Tata Group on artificial intelligence, according to people familiar with the matter, hours after another Indian conglomerate, Reliance Industries Ltd., announced a similar deal.

Headlines: India’s Reliance Explores Chipmaking Foray, Talking With Potential Partners - News18
Description: Billionaire Mukesh Ambani's Reliance Industries has begun exploring a foray into semiconductor manufacturing

Headlines: Kotak Mahindra AMC’s Nilesh Shah says he is not joining Jio BlackRock MF as CEO
Description: In July, Jio Financial Services Ltd, the demerged financial lending arm of Reliance Industries Ltd, and BlackRock, the world’s largest asset manager, joined hands to set up an asset management company with a combined investment of $300 million.

Headlines: Stocks To Watch: Reliance Industries, Jio, LIC, GlaxoSmithKline Pharma, PNB, Sula Vineyards, Nykaa
Description:
U.S equities were trading mixed on Thursday amid mixed economic data while traders awaited Friday's jobs report to catch some clues on Federal Reserve policy outlook, according to Bloomberg.

S&P 500 was up 0.23%, while Nasdaq traded 0.425 higher as of 2:32 p.m. New York time. Dow Jones, however, slipped 0.08%.

Headlines: Ambani To Focus On Reliance’s Succession Plans Over Five Years
Description: Mukesh Ambani said he will spend the next five years of his chairmanship of India’s most valuable company preparing his children to transform Reliance Industries Ltd. into a digital and green energy behemoth.

Headlines: Reliance AGM 2023: ‘JFS an invaluable addition to RIL,’ says Mukesh Ambani; to enter insurance sector
Description: Reliance AGM 2023: Mukesh Ambani said that like Reliance Retail and Reliance Jio, he is confident that Jio Financial Services will prove to be an invaluable addition to Reliance Industries’ ecosystem of consumer-facing businesses.

Headlines: Jio Sees 1,100 Cr GB Data Traffic Per Month, Crosses 450 Mn Subscribers: RIL Chairman Mukesh Ambani - News18
Description: "Jio, Reliance's digital services business, has witnessed another year of outstanding growth, posting a record high revenue of Rs 1,19,791 crore and an EBITDA of Rs 50,286 crore, reflecting a year-on-year revenue growth of over 20%," says Mukesh Ambani, chairman and MD of Reliance Industries Limited (RIL) at the AGM

Headlines: Reliance AGM 2023: Mukesh Ambani Moves Ahead With Succession As Isha, Anant, Akash Are Named On RIL Board
Description:
Mukesh Ambani further shaped his oil-to-telecom conglomerate's succession plan with his three children are set to join the board of Reliance Industries Ltd., the group’s parent.

While Nita Ambani stepped down from the board of Reliance Industries, Isha, Akash, and Anant have been named as executive directors on the board of RIL, according to an exchange filing even as Mukesh Ambani addressed shareholders at the company’s 46th annual general meeting.

Headlines: Jio 5G on track to cover entire country by Dec; JioAirFiber to be launched on Ganesh Chaturthi: Mukesh Ambani
Description: Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani, speaking at the company’s Annual General Meeting, said Jio's 5G rollout was the world's fastest and on track to cover entire India by December this year. Jio customer base has crossed 450 million. Its 5G network covers 96 per cent of towns and the company is on track to cover the entire country by December, he said.

Headlines: Reliance Foundation is the Beating Heart of Reliance, Says Nita Ambani at RIL AGM 2023 - News18
Description: Speaking at the 46th RIL AGM, Reliance Foundation Chairperson Nita Ambani said the NMACC in Mumbai has so far welcomed more than 20 lakh guests. “Our vision is to showcase the best of India to the world and bring the best of the world to India,” she said

Headlines: RIL AGM 2023 | Time for All in Biz Community to Work as Grand Coalition to Transform India: Mukesh Ambani - News18
Description: RIL AGM 2023: The Reliance Industries Ltd (RIL) chairman and managing director said that this grand coalition should work to transform India into a fully developed nation by 2047 ─ 'a prosperous India in which no Indian and no region will be left behind'

Headlines: Reliance AGM 2023: Mukesh Ambani To Remain Chairman & MD for Next 5 Years - News18
Description: Reliance AGM 2023 LIVE: RIL, under the leadership of Mukesh Ambani, is set to hold its 46th annual general meeting on Monday, August 28, 2023.

Headlines: Reliance AGM 2023 Updates: Jamnagar Giga Factory To Come Onstream By 2025
Description: Reliance Industries Ltd. will kick off its 46th annual general meeting at 2:00 p.m. on Monday. Investors will follow the annual speech by Chairman Mukesh Ambani closely, expecting key announcements on retail and telecom arms, the recently listed Jio Financial Services and roadmap for the conglomerate's green energy plans.

Headlines: Mukesh Ambani’s children join Reliance Board; Nita Ambani to step down
Description: The Board of Directors of Reliance Industries Limited considered and recommended to the shareholders for approval of appointment of Isha Ambani, Akash Ambani and Anant Ambani as Non-Executive Directors of the Company.

Headlines: RIL AGM 2023: Reliance Added 2.6 Lakh Jobs, Spent Rs 1,271 Crore on CSR, Announces Mukesh Ambani - News18
Description: The total number of our on-roll employees is nearly 3.9 lakh and the number of indirect livelihood opportunities we have created is many times larger, RIL Chairman Mukesh Ambani said at the AGM on Monday

Headlines: Reliance AGM 2023 Highlights: Mukesh Ambani Moves Ahead With Succession Plan, 5G And More
Description:
Billionaire Mukesh Ambani moved ahead with his succession plan as his three children will join the board of Reliance Industries Ltd., the parent of oil-to-telecom conglomerate. 

Ambani, chairman of the Reliance Industries, offered the road map for the company during its 46th AGM on Monday.

Headlines: Reliance AGM 2023: Date, Time, Where To Watch, What To Expect
Description: Mukesh Ambani-owned Reliance Industries Limited (RIL) will hold its 46th annual general meeting (AGM) on Monday, August 28, 2023. This will be RIL’s first AGM after the listing of Jio Financial Services (JFSL) shares on the stock exchanges.

Headlines: Reliance Industries to sell additional stake in retail arm
Description: Reliance Industries to sell 8-10% stake in Reliance Retail Ventures to fund expansion, retire debt and prepare for public listing. Process to take 12-15 months. Qatar Investment Authority announced $1 billion investment, doubling valuation to $100 billion. Funds to help Reliance fund future capital expenditure and keep retail debt under control.

Headlines: Day trading guide for August 25, 2023: Intraday supports, resistances for Nifty50 stocks
Description: The Day Trading Guide gives you the key intraday supports and resistances to watch out for on the Nifty Futures and other widely traded stocks such as Reliance Industries, Infosys, HDFC Bank, TCS and SBI. Based on the trend, it also gives intraday trade recommendations with specific entry as well as stop-loss levels. The mentioned resistances and supports will be the exit levels. Do note that the recommendations are based on Technical Analysis and there is a risk of loss in trading.

Headlines: Stocks To Watch: Reliance Industries, Shoppers Stop, Bharti Airtel, Granules India, Bharat Electronics
Description:
A rally in big tech stocks in the U.S. gradually ended as bond yields rose while traders waded through remarks of Federal Reserve officials and awaited Jerome Powell's speech on interest rates outlook, Bloomberg reported.

The S&P 500 declined 0.78%, while Nasdaq fell 1.12% as of 2:20 p.m. Dow Jones Industrial Average declined 0.76%. Brent crude prices fell 0.17% to $83.07 per bbl, while gold spot rates rose 0.10% to $1,917.41 per ounce.

Headlines: Reliance Industries and Oberoi Hotels to Co-manage Three Iconic Hospitality Projects in India, UK - News18
Description: The collaboration between the two companies will now oversee the management of Oberoi-operated Anant Vilas in Mumbai, an upcoming unnamed project in Gujarat and RIL-owned Stoke Park in UK

Headlines: RIL, Oberoi to co-manage three hospitality projects in India, U.K.
Description: Reliance Industries Ltd. has announced that it has entered into an understanding with The Oberoi Hotels and Resorts (Oberoi) to jointly manage three properties across India and the U.K.

Headlines: Sensex, Nifty slip as Reliance slide overpowers IT gains
Description: Indian shares reversed intraday gains on Thursday, Reliance Industries dragging the Nifty 50 0.29% lower. Mid- and small-caps outperformed blue-chips, driven by retail inflows and hopes of near-term returns. Reliance's $1bn investment in its retail arm led to a slight reduction in its SOTP valuation. IT stocks rose 0.61%, following Wall Street rally. RBI policy meeting minutes due at 5pm. Investors advised to stay stock-selective and cautious.

Headlines: Qatar Investment Authority to invest ₹8,278 crore in Reliance Retail Ventures
Description: Reliance Retail Ventures Ltd. (RRVL), a subsidiary of Reliance Industries Ltd., said that Qatar Investment Authority (QIA), through a wholly-owned subsidiary, has agreed to invest ₹8,278 crore in the company. This investment values RRVL at a pre-money equity value of ₹8.278 lakh crore, RRVL said in a statement.

Description: The Day Trading Guide gives you the key intraday supports and resistances to watch out for on the Nifty Futures and other widely traded stocks such as Reliance Industries, Infosys, HDFC Bank, TCS, and SBI. Headlines: Stocks To Watch: Reliance Industries, NHPC, P&G Health, Aeroflex Industries, Vascon Engineers, SJS Enterprises
Description:
U.S. stocks and bonds climbed after economic reports in both the U.S. and Europe bolstered speculation that major central banks will pause their interest-rate hikes to prevent a recession, reported Bloomberg. 

S&P 500 jumped 1.25% while Nasdaq surged 1.68% as of 2:14 p.m. Dow Jones rose 0.57%.

Headlines: Jio Financial Services shares decline 5% for second straight day
Description: LIC has acquired 6.66% stake in Jio Financial Services Ltd. post the demerger of Reliance Industries. The cost of acquisition was 4.68% of the demerged cost of Reliance Industries. Shares of Jio Financial Services fell 5% on both NSE and BSE.

Headlines: Day trading guide for Aug 22, 2023: Intraday supports, resistances for Nifty50 stocks
Description: The Day Trading Guide gives you the key intraday supports and resistances to watch out for on the Nifty Futures and other widely traded stocks such as Reliance Industries, Infosys, HDFC Bank, TCS and SBI. Headlines: Reliance Group’s Market Capitalisation Falls Over Rs 32,900 Crore
Description:
Reliance Group stocks lost market capitalisation by Rs 32,986 crore in a day, lead by Reliance Industries Ltd.

RIL's market cap fell nearly Rs 24,900 crore on Monday, following the muted listing of its financial services business on the Indian exchanges.

Headlines: Ambani’s $20 Billion Financial Unit Set to Debut in Mumbai
Description: Shares of Jio Financial Services Ltd., a recently spun off unit of Reliance Industries Ltd., made a weak start in a widely watched trading debut on Monday.

Headlines: Mcap of seven of top 10 firms declines by ₹80,200 crore; TCS, HDFC Bank biggest laggards
Description: Last week, 7 of the top 10 valued firms saw a combined market valuation drop of Rs 80,200.24 crore due to a weak equities trend. TCS and HDFC Bank were the biggest laggards, while Reliance Industries, Hindustan Unilever and Infosys gained. RIL remained the most valued firm, followed by TCS, HDFC Bank, ICICI Bank, HUL, Infosys, ITC, SBI, Airtel and Bajaj Finance.

Headlines: RIL says Jio Financial Services to get listed on August 21
Description: Jio Financial Services has already allotted equity shares of Jio Financial Services to shareholders of Reliance Industries to eligible shareholders.

Headlines: Jio Financial Services To Get Listed On Aug 21
Description:
Jio Financial Services Ltd. will start trading on the Bombay Stock Exchange on August 21, a notice from the exchange said. 

The issued, subscribed and paid-up equity capital of Jio Financial Services, post the demerger arrangement, stands at Rs 6,353.2 crore. This consists of 635.3 crore equity shares with a face value of Rs 10 apiece.

Headlines: Share Market Highlights 17 August, 2023: Sensex dips 388 pts; Nifty slips below 19,400; Adani Ports, Titan among top gainers
Description: Sensex, Nifty updates on 17 August 2023 – Snapping their two-day winning run, equity benchmarks Sensex and Nifty closed in the negative territory on Thursday, tracking losses in index majors Reliance Industries, ITC, and HDFC bank amid a weak trend in global markets. The BSE Sensex declined 388.40 points or 0.59 per cent to settle at 65,151.02. During the day, it fell by 493.32 points or 0.75 per cent to 65,046.10. The NSE Nifty slipped 99.75 points or 0.51 per cent to end at 19,365.25.

Headlines: Markets snap 2-day winning run; Sensex slumps nearly 390 pts on weak global cues
Description: Equity benchmarks Sensex & Nifty close in negative territory, tracking losses in index majors. Biggest loser ITC, followed by Power Grid, Reliance Industries, Larsen & Toubro, Nestle, Kotak Mahindra Bank, Bajaj Finance & JSW Steel. Asian & European markets trading lower; US markets ended in negative territory. FIIs bought equities worth ₹722.76 crore.

Headlines: Viacom18 completes merger of JioCinema and Voot OTT platforms, majority subscribers transitioned
Description: .Viacom18 has nearly completed merging its two OTT platforms, JioCinema and Voot. 90% of Voot Select subscribers have transitioned to JioCinema, with the remaining 10% expected to follow soon. The merger was part of Viacom18's scheme with Reliance Industries, Bodhi Tree Systems and Paramount Global. Voot has been dissolved, with all its content now available on JioCinema. Voot Select subscribers are being given the option to be onboarded onto JioCinema.

Headlines: Mcap of seven of top 10 firms falls by ₹74,603 cr; HDFC Bank biggest laggard
Description: Last week, seven of the top 10 valued firms saw a combined market valuation drop of ₹74,603.06 crore, with HDFC Bank suffering the biggest loss. ICICI Bank, Hindustan Unilever, Infosys, ITC, Bajaj Finance all saw erosion in their mcap, while Reliance Industries, TCS and SBI added to theirs. Reliance Industries remained the most valued firm, followed by TCS, HDFC Bank, ICICI Bank, Hindustan Unilever, Infosys, ITC, SBI, Bharti Airtel and Bajaj Finance.

Headlines: Sensex, Nifty climb in early trade
Description: Mumbai bourses climb in early trade, Sensex up 210 pts; ICICI Bank, Reliance Industries, Mahindra & Mahindra, Sun Pharma, Larsen & Toubro, NTPC, UltraTech Cement, Wipro, TCS, HCL Tech & Reliance Industries gain. Tokyo & Hong Kong up, Seoul & Shanghai down. U.S. markets end lower. FIIs offload equities worth ₹556.32 cr. Sensex up 0.74% on Fri, Nifty up 0.70%.

Headlines: Equity markets climb in early trade
Description: Mumbai equity indices rise on Aug 7, buoyed by ICICI Bank and Reliance Industries. Sensex up 210.43 pts to 65,931.68, Nifty 66.1 pts to 19,583.10. Asian markets mixed, U.S. markets lower. FIIs offload equities worth ₹556.32 crore. Sensex up 0.74%, Nifty 0.70% on Fri.

Headlines: RIL Annual Report FY23: Mukesh Ambani On Performance, Net Carbon Zero Goal, Jio Financial
Description:
Mukesh Ambani, Chairman and Managing Director of Reliance Industries Ltd., underlined the financial performance of the oil-to-telecom conglomerate in a note to shareholders on Sunday.

In RIL's annual report released today, Ambani said that the company managed strong operating and financial show during the fiscal 2023 despite continued volatility in the global markets.

Headlines: Reliance Targets Affordable Green Hydrogen As Clean Fuel Alternative: Mukesh Ambani - News18
Description: Reliance Industries’ first ever green hydrogen production was achieved with firing of torrefied biomass in gasifiers in 2022-23.

Headlines: Share Market Highlights 31 July 2023:: Sensex, Nifty close higher on Monday; IT, metals, and oil & gas lead sectoral gains
Description: Sensex, Nifty updates on 31 July 2023: Indian benchmark equity indices, Sensex and Nifty, rebounded by over half a per cent on Monday, led by buying in major stocks like Reliance Industries and Tata Consultancy Services, as well as strong global trends. Sensex closed at 66,527.67 with a gain of 0.56%, while Nifty ended at 19,753.80, up by 0.55%. Power, oil, IT, and FMCG sectors saw advances, with NTPC posting a notable 23% rise in consolidated net profit for the April-June quarter. Meanwhile, Bajaj Finance, Kotak Mahindra Bank, and others witnessed losses.

Headlines: Sensex rebounds 367 pts, Nifty settles above 19,750 on firm global trends
Description: Benchmark equity indices Sensex and Nifty closed over half a per cent higher on Monday,  snapping their two-day falling streak on buying in index majors Reliance Industries and Tata Consultancy Services and firm global trends. The 30-share BSE Sensex jumped 367.47 points or 0.56 per cent to settle at 66,527.67. The index opened lower but later rebounded from early lows and hit a high of 66,598.42 as power, oil, IT and FMCG shares advanced. The NSE Nifty climbed 107.75 points or 0.55 per cent to end at 19,753.80.

Headlines: Stocks To Watch: Reliance Industries, Maruti Suzuki, Vedanta, Federal Bank, SJVN, Tata Steel, Wipro
Description:
U.S. stocks posted small gains and global bonds climbed on Monday after weak economic data in both the U.S. and Europe fueled concern about a global slowdown, reported Bloomberg.  

The equity markets are set to traverse through their busiest earnings week this season, with over 500 major companies worldwide due to report quarterly results, including U.S. megacaps such as Alphabet Inc. and Meta Platforms Inc.

Headlines: D-Street gives thumbs down to Reliance Industries
Description: Shares of Reliance Industries fell 2% on Monday, as Q1 performance disappointed traders. Analysts are divided on the stock's upside potential, with Jefferies increasing target price to ₹3,100 and Systematix cutting target price to ₹2,550. Motilal Oswal noted mixed bag in consumer business, while B & K Securities said consumer electronics business delivered steady growth. Media business recorded gross revenue of ₹3,790 crore, up 143.3% y-o-y. BNP Paribas raised target price to ₹2,925. Analysts see limited upside for stock from current levels.

Headlines: RIL to acquire 33% stake in Brookfield-Digital Realty data centre venture
Description: Reliance Industries has acquired a 33.33 per cent stake in a joint venture set up by Brookfield Infrastructure and Digital Realty for developing data centers in India. RIL will invest ₹378 crore to acquire the stake in each of the five special purpose vehicles set up under the joint venture company called Mercury Holdings SG Pte Ltd.

Headlines: Reliance Industries’ consumer businesses cushions the conglomerate’s overall numbers
Description: Q1 numbers were affected by O2C; analysts optimistic about the way forward, with the potential listing of some of the newer businesses

Headlines: Reliance Industries share price down
Description: Reliance Industries Limited shares declined by 2 per cent following the announcement of its first-quarter results. The consolidated net profit for the June quarter decreased by 11 per cent compared to the previous year, with a 5.3 per cent drop in revenue. The oil-to-chemicals business was a significant contributing factor to the decline in net profit. The shares were down to ₹2,485.50 at 09:46 am on the BSE.

Headlines: Reliance shares drop 2.3 pc
Description: Reliance Industries: Profit drops 2.3% in pre-open trading due to weak demand and falling refining margins in O2C business.

Headlines: RIL June quarter net profit down 11% on year, revenue down 5.3%
Description: Reliance Industries reported a 10.8% YoY decline in net profit to ₹Rs 16,011 crore, below street estimates. Revenue of ₹Rs 2.1 lakh crore was down 5.3% YoY. Oils-to-chemicals business revenue dropped to ₹Rs 1.3 lakh crore, while retail and digital services revenue increased to ₹Rs 69,962 crore and ₹Rs 32,077 crore, respectively. Operating margin was 11.4%, lower than 11.9% YoY.

Headlines: Reliance Industries Q1FY24 Net Profit Declines 6% Dented By Oil-To-Chemicals Performance - News18
Description: The conglomerate’s consolidated total revenue in the June quarter declined to Rs 231,132 crore from Rs 242,529 crore a year ago, as oil-to-chemicals business revenue declined tracking weakness in crude prices.

Headlines: Reliance Industries Q1 Results: Net Profit Down 14.4% On Increased Finance Cost
Description:
Reliance Industries Ltd.'s profit fell for the first quarter of FY24, on account of higher finance cost and depreciation during the quarter. 

The Mukesh Ambani-led conglomerate’s consolidated net profit fell 14.4% sequentially to Rs 18,258 crore in the quarter ended June, according to its exchange filing. That compares with the Rs 16,995.49-crore consensus estimate of analysts tracked by Bloomberg.

Headlines: Reliance Industries demerger: How will income tax be calculated on Jio Financial shares?
Description: It is important to understand how capital gains and the cost of acquisition will be determined for the new demerged entity

Headlines: RIL GDRs plunge 6% in London trading post Q1 results
Description: RIL GDRs were trading at $62.30, down 6.46 per cent. To be sure, shares of Reliance Industries saw selling in the domestic market earlier today

Headlines: Reliance Industries will have special pre-market trading session today for demerger
Description: NSE, BSE to conduct special pre-market session on July 20 for Reliance Industries' demerger. Shareholders to get one share of JFSL for each Reliance share held. New contracts to be introduced, existing contracts expired. Reliance to declare Q1 results, dividend on July 21. Jio Financial to feature in 18 BSE, 18 NSE indices.

Headlines: What does the demerger of Reliance Industries and Jio Financials mean to investors
Description: Reliance Industries and Jio Financial Services were discovered at Rs 2,580 and Rs 261.85 respectively in the special pre-open session. The demerger of Reliance Strategic Investments, renamed Jio Financial Services, is to create value for shareholders. The ratio for demerger is 1:1 and JFSL will be part of Nifty and Sensex indices for 3 days. JFSL is expected to list within 2-3 months at ₹160/share. Investors with long-term perspective should continue to hold RIL stock.

Headlines: Here’s How Nifty Has Fared Since Moving Past 19,000
Description:
The NSE Nifty 50 took 21 sessions to climb from 19,000 to its current life-time high of 19991.85 on buying by overseas funds.

Domestic institutional investors reported a net outflow of Rs 11,340.6 crore for the duration, while foreign institutional investors saw a net inflow of Rs 36,684.1 crore as of market close on Thursday.

Headlines: Reliance Industries Q1 Preview: Weak Gross Refining Margin To Hurt Profit, Revenue
Description: Reliance Industries Ltd.'s first-quarter revenues and profits are likely to drop year-on-year on weak refining margins and flat performance of the oil-to-chemicals segment during the period.

Headlines: RIL stock rises by 1.19 per cent after demerger
Description: Reliance Industries demerges digital fintech division, JFSL, with 1:1 ratio. Shareholders receive one JFSL share if held on or before July 19. Post-demerger cost of acquisition of RIL shares is 95.32%, RSIL share is 4.68%. JFSL shares valued at ₹262 at end of special trading session. RIL shares up 1.19% to Rs 2619.75 at 01:35 p.m. on BSE.

Headlines: Jio Financial Valued At Rs 261.9 Apiece, Reliance Lists At Rs 2,617 After Special Session
Description:
Shares of Reliance Industries Ltd. were listed at Rs 2,617 per share after the special pre-open session conducted to determine its share price after carving out Jio Financial Services Ltd. as a separate listed entity.

The listing price of Reliance Industries was at a 3.5% discount to the apportionment cost of acquisition for RIL, which was set at Rs 2,708.85 per share.

Headlines: Jio Financial Demerger: Reliance Industries Special Pre-Open Session Today
Description:
The F&O contracts of Reliance Industries Ltd. for the next three months will expire today. 

"All existing contracts with expiry dates of July 27, Aug. 31, and Sept. 28, will expire today. The methodology of settlement shall be separately intimated by the respective Clearing Corporations," the NSE said in a press release.

Headlines: Today is the last date to buy Reliance shares for Jio Financial share eligibility
Description: Reliance Industries must be bought today to get Jio Financial shares. Axis Securities values Jio Financial at Rs. 160/share. NSE & BSE will conduct a special pre-market session on July 20 for demerger. Investors should buy RIL before record date for economical Jio Financial shares. Jio Financial will be included in 18 BSE & 22 NSE indices from July 20.

Headlines: Stocks that will see action today: July 19, 2023
Description: Reliance Industries shares turn ex-date on July 20; shareholders to get Jio Financial shares. Schaeffler appoints Aashish Bhatia as President for Automotive OEM. Lemon Tree Hotels signs new property in Lucknow. GAIL partners with US-based LanzaTech to explore CO2 capture. SBI to set up new trustee company for CDMDF.
